sentences.en: " Pride comes before a fall " is a famous dictum.
sentences.cn: “ 骄必败 ” 乃至理名言.

sentences.en: Descartes’ famous dictum: ‘I think; therefore, I am’
sentences.cn: 笛卡尔的名言 “我思故我在”

sentences.en: Foolish dictum: In a team , a valuable team player must aspire to be leader.
sentences.cn: 启示:愚蠢的格言 -- “组织中的每个人,若想成为有价值的成员, 必须立志成为领导”.

sentences.en: He was made to order for Bethune, who now invoked his famous dictum with a vengeance.
sentences.cn: 他正合白求恩的口味, 白求恩彻头彻尾遵循他的名言.

sentences.en: It is an honour to use their own interpretation of this dictum.
sentences.cn: 很荣幸能用自身来诠释这句名言.

sentences.en: Perhaps this is behind Thoreau's dictum: In wildness is the salvation of the world.
sentences.cn: 也许这正是梭罗的这一断言的隐含意义: 人类的救世主是大自然.

sentences.en: Remember the dictum our professor taught us, diffidence leads to envy which gives rise to spite.
sentences.cn: 记住教授告诉我们的名言:缺乏自信会导致嫉妒,进而产生怨恨.

sentences.en: She reminded us of Barnum's dictum: You could sell anything to anybody if you marketed it right.
sentences.cn: 她提醒我们想想巴纳姆的名言：如果营销得力，你可以把任何东西卖给任何人。

sentences.en: Watch sellers employ a logical Italian dictum: a well - dressed man owns at least timepieces.
sentences.cn: 手表经销商流传的一句意大利格言不无道理: 穿着得体的男人至少拥有三块表.

sentences.en: Yet Kissinger succeeded in defying an old Washington dictum that you can have in the capital visibility or influence, but not both.
sentences.cn: 在华盛顿有一条传统格言:要么抛头露面,要么得势弄权, 二者不可兼得. 基辛格却公然蔑视这种传统.

words.tran_cn: 格言；声明；法官的附带意见

trans.tran_en: a formal statement of opinion by someone who is respected or has authority
